channel.title: Can I run Whonix as regular (host) OS? Without virtualization
channel.description: Can I use Whonix as I use any primary OS (e.g. Windows), not virtually runned? My CPU is 64-bit but doesn't support virtualization, so VirtualBox, Hyper-V and etc. can't provide installing of 64-bit guest OS'es. Only way is install Whonix as regular OS (how?) or inside Qubes (I not sure it will work).

item.title: Can I run Whonix as regular (host) OS? Without virtualization
item.dc:creator: Fullstack
item.description:
Thank you for that reference

Read full topic

item.title: Can I run Whonix as regular (host) OS? Without virtualization
item.dc:creator: Fullstack
item.description:
Yes, “to run the VMs”. But my question is about installing directly on physical machine, using Whonix as bootable OS

Read full topic
item.source: Can I run Whonix as regular (host) OS? Without virtualization

item.title: Can I run Whonix as regular (host) OS? Without virtualization
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/Build_Documentation/Physical_Isolation perhaps.

Fullstack:

Only way is install Whonix as regular OS (how?) or inside Qubes (I not sure it will work).

Qubes itself uses virtualization (Xen).

Read full topic
item.source: Can I run Whonix as regular (host) OS? Without virtualization

item.title: Can I run Whonix as regular (host) OS? Without virtualization
item.dc:creator: onion_knight
item.description:
Simple answer: no.

You need virtualization capacities to run the VMs.

Read full topic
